Function Documentation

rpkt_t* pkt_execute ( rpkt_t *  rpkt,
conn_t *  pConn 
)

Checks method needs to transfer some data in response. Apparently there is not much method that need to transfer data

Parameters:
strm The stream that contains the method id to be checked
Returns:
0 The method (therefore a strm) doesn't require the data to be transferred in response 1 Otherwise (the data are required to be transferred)

void strm_execute ( strm_t *  strm,
conn_t *  pConn 
)

int strm_expects_response ( strm_t *  strm  ) 

indicates if some data somehow needs to be transferred from the execution place (callee) to the calling (caller); compare with rsp_strm_has_data; seems that they are doing very similar thing, although this asks about the in parameters as well, and rsp_strm_has_data tells that you should receive the extra buffer of response, not only a response via function arguments

Returns:
1 means yes, some data need to be transferred via (rsp_buffer or via parameters) 0 it doesn't expect the response
